l.hi:
¶ Explicit fabula mancipii de Coruo
Incipit ꝓprohemiūn fabule Rectoris

div.l: Tho that the Mauciple / hadde his tale al eendid
The sonne from the south lyne / was descendid
So lowe / that hit was nat to my sight
Degrees twelf / nat off hiht
Foure of the Clok / hit was tho as I gesse
For elevene foote / or litel more or lesse
My shadwe was / at thilke tyme as there
Off such as my leenght / partid were
In six feet / equal of ꝓproporciou
Therwith the moonys exaltaciou
I meene libra / alwey gan ascende
As we were entryng / at a thorpis eende
For whiche our hoste / as he was wont to guye
As in this caas / this Ioly companye
Seyde in this wise / lordynges euerichoon
Now lacketh vs / no mo talis than oon
Fullfilled is my sentence / and my decree
I trowe that we han herd of ech degree
Almost fullfilled is myn ordinauce
I pray to god yeve hym riht good chauce
That telle vs shal a tale lustily
Then preest ꝙquodd he art thou a Vikary
Or art a ꝑpersou sey soth bi thi fey
Be what thou be breke thou nat our pley
For every man save thou hath tolde a tale
Vnbokele and shew vs what is in thy male
For trewly me thynketh bi thi cheere
Thou sholdist knytte vp wel a gret mateer
Telle vs a fable anoon for cokkis bonys
This ꝑpersou answerd alle attoonys
Thou getist fable noon I tolde for me
For Poule that wryteth vnto Tymothe
Repreeveth hem that weyven sothfastnesse
And tellith talis of any shrewdenesse
Why shold I sowe draff oute of my fest
Whan I mow sow whete / yif that me lest
For whiche I seye / yif that ye list to heere
Moralite and vertuous mateere
And alle tho that wol yeven audieūnce
I wol ful fayn at Crystes reuereuce
Do you pleesauce leefful as I can
But trustith wel I am a suthern man
I cannat geste rum ram ruf bi lettre
No god wot / ryme holde I but litil bettre
And therfore yif ye list I will nat glose
I wille you tellen a mery tale in prose
To knytte vp alle this feest / and maake an eende
And ihu for his grace / wit me seende
To shewe you the weye / in this viage
Off that ilke ꝑperfyt / glorious pilgrymage
That hihte Ierusalem celestial
And yiff ye vouchesauf / anoon I shal
Begynne vpon my tale / for whiche I preye
Telle your avys / I amcanamcan no bettre seye
But natheles / this meditaciou
I put it ay vndir correcciou
Off clerkys / for I am nat textuel
I take but the sentence trust me wel
Therfore I make a protestaciou
That I wol stonde / to correcciou
Vpon this woord we han assentid soon
For as vs seemyd / hit was for to doon
To eendyn / in som vertuous sentence
And for to yeve hym space and audience
And boden our hoost he sholde to hym seye
That alle we to telle his tale preye
Our hoost hadde the woordis for vs alle
Sire preest qd he nowe faire you befalle
Sey what yow list / and we wol gladly heere
And with that woord he seide in this maneere
Tellith qd he / your meditaciou
But hastith you / the sonne wol a dou
Beeth fructuous / and that in litel space
And to do wel god send you his grace

Explicit prohemium Rectoris Incipit
narracio eiusdem . et est ultima de hiis
quas Chauucer composuit .

div.ab:
(base) Here bigynneth the Persons tale
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.

(base) Ovre swete lord god of heuene that no man wole
perisse but wole that we comen alle to the kNoweliche
of hym and to the blisful lyf that is pardurable
(base) amonesteth vs by the prophete Ieromie that seith in this wise

(base) Stondeth vp on the weyes and seeth and axeth of olde pathes that is to seyn of olde sentences which is the goode
wey
(base) and walketh in that wey and ye shal fynde refresshynge for youre soules et cetera

(base) Manye been the weyes espirituels that leden folk to oure lord Ihesu crist and to the regne
of glorie

(base) of whiche weyes ther is a ful noble wey and
a ful couenable which may nat faile to man ne to womman that thurgh synne hath mysgoon fro the righte wey
of Ierusalem celestial

(base) and this wey is clepid Penitence
of which men sholde gladly herknen and enquere with al
his herte

(base) to wite what is penitence and whennes it is
clepid penitence and in how manye maneres been the accions
or werkynges of penitence

(base) and how manye spices ther
ben of penitences and whiche thynges apertenen and bihouen to penitence whiche thynges destourben penitence

(base) Seint Ambrose seith that penitence is the pleynynge of
man for the gilt that he hath doon and namoore to doon
any thyng for which hym oghte to pleyne

(base) And som dectour seith Penitence is the waymentynge of man that sorweth for his synne and pyneth hym self for he hath
mysdoon

(base) Penitence with certeyne circumstances is verray
repentance of a man that halt hym self in sorwe and oother
peyne for hise giltes

(base) and for he shal be verray penitent
he shal first biwailen the synnes that he hath doon and
stedefastly purposen in his herte to haue shrift of mouthe
and to doon satisfaccioun

(base) and neuere to doon thyng for which
hym oghte moore to biwaile or to compleyne and to continue in goode werkes or ellis his repentance may nat auayle
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image.

(base) For as seith Seint Isydre he is a Iapere and a gabbere and
no verray repentant that eft soone dooth thyng for which hym
oghte repente

(base) wepynge and nat for to stynte to do synne
may nat auaile

(base) But nathelees men shal hope that at euery
tyme that man falleth be it neuer so ofte that he may arise thurgh
penitence if he haue grace but certeynly it is greet dowithe

(base) for
as seith Seint Gregorie vnnethe ariseth he out of his synne
that is charged with the charge of yuel vsage

(base) and ther fore
repentant folk that stynte for to synne and forlete synne er that
synne forlete hem holy chirche halt hem siker of hire sauacion

(base) and he that synneth and verraily repenteth hym in his laste
holy chirche yet hopeth his sauacioun by the grete mercy of oure
lord Ihesu crist for his repentance but taak the siker wey

(base) and
Now sith that I haue declared yow what thyng is penitence
Now shul ye vnderstonde that ther been iij accions of penitence
(base) The firste is that if a man be baptised after that he hath synned

(base) Seint
Augustyn seith but he be penitent for his olde synful lyf he may
nat bigynne the newe clene lyf

(base) for certes if he be baptised with
oute penitence of his olde gilt he receyueth the mark of baptesme but nat the grace ne the remissioun of hise synnes til he haue repentance verray

(base) Another defaute is this that men doon
deedly synne after that they han receyued baptesme

(base) The
thridde defaute is that men fallen in venyal synnes after
hire baptesme fro day to day

(base) ther of seith Seint Augustyn
That penitence of goode and of humble folk is the penitence
of euery day

(base) The speces of penaunce been iij that oon of
hem is solempne Another is commune and the thridde is priuee

(base) Thilke penaunce that is solempne is in two maneres as
to be put out of holy chirche in lente for slaughtre of children
and swich manere thyng

(base) Another is whan man hath synned
openly of which synne the fame is openly spoken in the contree
and thanne holy chirche by
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image. Iugement destreyneth hym for to
doon open penance

(base) Commune penaunce is that preestes enioynen
men communly in certeyn cas as for to goon parauenture naked in
pilgrymage or barefoot

(base) Pryuee penaunce is thilke that men
doon al day for priuee synnes of whiche we shryue vs pryuely
and receyue pryuee penance

(base) Now shaltow vnderstande
what bihoueth and is necessarie to verray parfit penitence and
this stant on iij thynges

(base) Contricioun of herte Confessioun of
Mouth and Satisfaccioun

(base) for which seith Seint Iohn Grisostomus
Penitence destreyneth man to accepte benygnely euery peyne that hym
is enioyned with contricioun of herte and shrift of Mowithhe with satisfaccioun and in wirkynge of alle manere humylitee

(base) and this is
fruytful penitence agayn iij thynges in whiche we wrathe oure
lord Ihesu crist
(base) this is to seyn by delit in thynkynge by recchelesnesse in spekynge by wikked synful wirkynge

(base) and agayns
thise wikkede giltes is penitence that may be likned vn to a tree

(base) The roote of this tree is contricioun that hideth hym in the herte of
hym that is verray repentant right as the roote of a tree hideth
hym in the erthe

(base) Of the roote of Contricioun spryngeth a stalke
that bereth branches and leues of confessioun and fruyt of satisfaccioun

(base) for which crist seith in his gospel dooth digne fruyt
of penitence for by this fruyt may men kNowe this tree and
nat by the roote that is hyd in the herte of man ne by the branches ne the leues of Confessioun

(base) And therfore oure Lord Ihesu crist
seith thus by the fruyt of hem shul ye kNowe hem

(base) Of this
roote eek spryngeth a Seed of grace the which Seed is moder
of Sikernesse and this Seed is egre and hoot

(base) the grace of thys
Seed spryngeth of god thurgh remembrance on the day of dome
and on the peynes of helle

(base) Of this matere seith Salomon that
in the drede of god man forleteth his synne

(base) the hete of thys
seed is the loue of god and the desir
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image. ynge of the Ioye pardurable

(base) this hete draweth the herte of man to god and dooth hym hate
his synne

(base) for soothly ther is no thyng that sauoureth so wel
to a child as the mylk of his norice ne no thyng is to hym
moore abhomynable than thilke mylk whan it is medled with
oother mete

(base) right so the synful man that loueth his synne
hym semeth it is to hym moost swete of any thyng

(base) but fro that
tyme that he loueth sadly oure lord Ihesu crist and desireth the lyf
pardurable ther nys to hym no thyng moore abhomynable

Dauid the prophete seith I haue loued thy lawe and hated wikkednesse and hate he that loueth god kepeth his lawe and his word

(base) this tree saugh the prophete Daniel in Spirit vp on the auysion of
Nabugodonosor whanne he conseiled hym to do penitence

(base) Penance is the tree of lyf to hem that it receyuen and he that holdeth
hym in verray penitence is blessed after the Sentence of Salomon

(base) In this penitence or Contricioun man shal vnderstonde
iiij thynges that is to seyn what is Contricioun and whiche
ben the causes that moeuen a man to Contricioun and how he
sholde be contrit and what Contricioun auaileth to the soule

(base) thanne
is it thus that Contricioun is the verray sorwe that a man receyueth

(base) and this sorwe shal ben
in this manere as seith Seint Bernard It shal ben heuy and
greuous and ful sharpe and poynaunt in herte

(base) first for man hath
agilt his lord and his Creatour and moore sharp and poynaunt

(base) and yet moore sharpe and
poynaunt for he hath wrathed and agilt hym that boughte hym
that with his precious blood hath delyuered vs fro the bondes of synne and fro the creweltee of the deuel and fro the peynes of helle

(base) The causes that oghten moeuen a man to Contricioun been vj
ffirst a man shal remembren hym of
Text on this page supplied initially from the base text. Delete this note when revised against the manuscript image. hise synnes

(base) but looke
that thilke remembrance ne be to hym no delit by no wey but gret

(base) And therfore seith Ezechie I
wol remembre me alle the yeris of my lyf in bitternesse of myn
herte

(base) And god seith in the Apocalipes Remembre yow fro whennes that ye ben falle for biforn that tyme that ye synned ye
were the children of god and lymes of the regne of god

for youre synne ye ben woxe thral and foul and membres of

yet be ye fouler for youre longe contynuynge in synne and
